activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11843
activity.text:
Hey @nihal467,

I‚Äôve approached this issue by conditionally rendering the questionnaire print button so that it appears on all relevant pages except when the current route corresponds to `facility/..../encouter/.../treatment_summary`.

1) It seems to work fine ‚Äî the button is still there on other pages and hidden where it shouldn‚Äôt be. I've tried to keep the logic simple. Am I good to go with this approach, or would you suggest any changes? üòÑ 

---

2) Also, I know we usually follow certain conventions ‚Äî like keeping UI text in i18n files and so on ‚Äî but I wasn‚Äôt sure if that‚Äôs required here, so I just used it directly for now.

For the route check, I used:
```js
const path = usePath() || "";
const isTreatmentSummaryRoute = path?.includes("/treatment_summary");
```

- Does this look good?
cc @AdityaJ2305 @nihal467

If everything looks fine, I‚Äôll go ahead and raise the PR! üòå

> > > Do close one
> >

activity.text:
> @karanziie1990, you already have an open PR for this issue: #11838
> 
> It‚Äôs always recommended to maintain a single PR per issue and make the necessary changes within that. Having multiple PRs for the same issue can create confusion for reviewers and may lead to delays in merging
> 
> Do close one

Hey @AdityaJ2305, thanks for the heads-up! :smile: 
I‚Äôll definitely keep that in mind going forward ‚Äî I‚Äôm still getting familiar with the norms around open source contributions and appreciate the guidance.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11848
activity.text:
Yes @rithviknishad why not üòÅ
As you said, I took inspiration directly from the device page, which uses `className="flex flex-col gap-4..."`, and updated the facility page accordingly by changing `space-y-2` to `space-y-4` for better vertical spacing.

Let me know if any further tweaks are needed ‚Äî otherwise, I‚Äôll go ahead, edit it and push the update. :)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8132d797-4061-4eda-91e5-70ab56f2adfa)

Thanks for the review!
